title: Dropout(inplace=True) gives weird error message when input is Tensor
body_html:
>>> import torch                                                                       
>>> a = torch.randn(10)                                                                
>>> b = torch.nn.functional.dropout(a, p=0.5, inplace=True)                            
Traceback (most recent call last):                                                     
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>                                                  
  File "/home/ssnl/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/nn/functional.py", line 
    return _functions.dropout.Dropout.apply(input, p, training, inplace)               
RuntimeError: mark_dirty only accepts input tensors, but argument 0 isn't one
>>> b = torch.nn.functional.dropout(torch.autograd.Variable(a), p=0.5, inplace=True) # works
body_text:
>>> import torch                                                                       
>>> a = torch.randn(10)                                                                
>>> b = torch.nn.functional.dropout(a, p=0.5, inplace=True)                            
Traceback (most recent call last):                                                     
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>                                                  
  File "/home/ssnl/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/nn/functional.py", line 
    return _functions.dropout.Dropout.apply(input, p, training, inplace)               
RuntimeError: mark_dirty only accepts input tensors, but argument 0 isn't one
>>> b = torch.nn.functional.dropout(torch.autograd.Variable(a), p=0.5, inplace=True) # works
body:
```
>>> import torch                                                                       
>>> a = torch.randn(10)                                                                
>>> b = torch.nn.functional.dropout(a, p=0.5, inplace=True)                            
Traceback (most recent call last):                                                     
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>                                                  
  File "/home/ssnl/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/nn/functional.py", line 
    return _functions.dropout.Dropout.apply(input, p, training, inplace)               
RuntimeError: mark_dirty only accepts input tensors, but argument 0 isn't one
>>> b = torch.nn.functional.dropout(torch.autograd.Variable(a), p=0.5, inplace=True) # works   
```
